googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationDirections:
1. Wyoming prefers that people register to vote in person at their Local Election Office.
2. If this isn't possible, you'll need to fill out the  [Wyoming Voter Registration form](http://soswy.state.wy.us/Forms/Elections/General/VoterRegistrationForm.pdf) and have it notarized.
3. The notary will ask to see a photo ID, so make sure you bring your ID with you.
4. Mail your notarized form, and a **photocopy** of your ID, to your [Local Election Office](http://www.voteamerica.com/local-election-offices/).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Wyoming driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Wyoming voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Wyoming Secretary of State  
Herschler Building East  
122 W 25th St 
Suites 100 and 101  
Cheyenne, WY 82002-0020
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting:
Wyoming does not require photo ID for the purpose of voting. 

However, if you registered by mail and are voting in a federal election for the first time, you must show photo ID or a document that has both your name and residence address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driverâ€™s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Wyoming voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Wyoming you must:

* be a citizen of the United States
* be 18 years old by the General Election Day
* be a resident of the State of Wyoming
* not be currently adjudicated mentally incompetent
* not have been convicted of a felony, or if convicted have had your voting rights restored
* Note that you must re-register to vote if you did not vote in the last general election.
